content: duck revisited duck has been a popular design since it was published in 2010 it is with great pleasure that i now offer this updated pattern with an easier construction new schematics and an instructional format geared for visual learners difficulty level intermediate/adventurous size newborn to 6 mo gauge 32 sts & 43 rounds = 4 worked in stockinette stitch in the round materials light fingering weight yarn approximately 150 yd/137 m per pair tools - us size 2/2 75 mm needles for knitting in the round or whatever needle size yields the specified stitch gauge* - cordsmith highly recommended for working i-cord or 2 us size 2/2 75 mm dpns - yarn needle about the pattern format i write my instructions specifically for visual learners using a table format that helps the knitter to visualize the structure standard line by line instructions are in the appendix key techniques abbreviations used please visit the tutorials linked below or use these k knit keywords to search for additional online resources p purl st stitch cast ons tbl through back loop - judy s magic cast on m1r make 1 right r-leaning increase - turkish cast on m1l make 1 left l-leaning increase increase k2tog knit 2 together r-leaning decrease work as you - m1 m1l m1r would a k stitch but with 2 sts held together bindoffs ssk l-leaning decrease slip the next 2 stitches - 3-needle bindoff knitwise one at a time then return to l needle - jeny s surprisingly stretchy bindoff and knit them together through the back loops applied i-cord jmco judy s magic cast on - using 2 dpns tco turkish cast on - using a cordsmith jssbo jeny s surprisingly stretchy bindoff * i recommend circular needles for this project for questions on using dpns please consult the community resources on ravelry 2 structure the sock is worked toe up then i-cords are applied afterwards for visual effect the diagram below shows the different sections of the sock and the purl channels through which you will later apply the i-cord toes side view top view start lower purl foot channels gusset heel cuff lower foot to approximate the webbed shape of a duck s foot this sock casts on over 6 consecutive rounds on the turkish cast on tco rounds 1 wrap around both needles = 2 cast on sts and the first stitch of the round is the tco wrap on the top needle that you just cast on work the tco sts through the back loop to even out stitch gauge to view instructions in standard line by line format please visit the appendix setup using jmco co 6 sts 3 sts on each needle work ½ round k1 p1 k1 stop top bottom round 1 tco 2 k1 tbl k1 p1 k1 tco 2 k1 tbl k1 p1 k2 10 sts round 2 tco 2 k1 tbl k2 p1 k2 tco 2 k1 tbl k2 p1 k3 14 sts round 3 tco
